Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when you are asking a coin to change their consensus algo, it is expected that there is some coordination between the projects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to have that process totally decentralized, seems quite courageous

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and notarizations are basically an oracle, we know from zack that aggregation does not work for oracles. using elected notaries we dont have just any random attacker on the internet able to submit notarizations. being fully decentralized means you allow attackers to notarize and somehow have to differentiate between attacker notarizations and non-attacker ones.
